awd_titl_txt: Re-Os Dating of Molybdenites from the North American        Cordillera and Crustal/Mantle Contributions to              Metallogenesis
awd_abstract_narration: The are two molybdenite polytypes; a hexagonal (2H) and the more                rare rhombohedral (3R). The purpose of this study is to                         determine which molybdenite polytype is most likely to remain                   closed to Re-Os exchange after deposition.  The PI proposes to                  obtain molybdenites from different types of ore-deposits of known               age, and determine the polytype by XRD analysis and analyze the                 Re-Os abundances by isotope dilution using an ICP-MS.  The second               purpose of this work is to determine the Re-Os isotope                          systematics of sulfides from porphyry copper/molybdenum deposits                from Arizona, New Mexico, northern Mexico, Nevada and Utah in                   order to constrain the crust/mantle input of metals into these                  systems.
